reschedule

public void reschedule()
                throws CondorException
Sends a 'reschedule' signal to make rescheduling process happens. Simply invokes 'condor_reschedule '

Throws:
CondorException

rm

public void rm(Job job)
        throws CondorException
Removes a job. This method will block till the removal finishes. Just invokes 'condor_rm'

Parameters:
job - - a Job to remove
Throws:
CondorException

rm

public void rm(Cluster cluster)
        throws CondorException
Removes jobs in a cluster. This method will block till the removal finishes. Just invokes 'condor_rm'

Parameters:
cluster - - A Cluster to remove
Throws:
CondorException

setLogFile

public void setLogFile(java.lang.String logfile,
                       double interval)
Sets logfile name and monitor interval.

Parameters:
logfile - - log file name to monitor
interval - - interval to monitor in seconds

submit

public Cluster submit(JobDescription jd)
               throws CondorException
Submits a job description to the condor and returns a cluster of job

Parameters:
jd - - JobDescription to submit
Throws:
CondorException

getJob

public Job getJob(JobId jobId)
Lookups job map with jobId and returns a Job. If there is no job corresponds to the jobId registered, create it. This is useful if you want to keep track of a job that is not submitted by the API.

Parameters:
jobId - - JobId to lookup

getAliveJobs

public java.util.Collection<Job> getAliveJobs()
getAliveJobs: returns alive (not completed and not removed) jobs
